iCanWin

public int iCanWin()
Returns the column that would allow the agent to win. You might want your agent to check to see if it has a winning move available to it so that it can go ahead and make that move. Implement this method to return what column would allow the agent to win.

Returns:
the column that would allow the agent to win.

move

public void move()
The move method is run every time it is this agent's turn in the game. You may assume that when move() is called, the game has at least one open slot for a token, and the game has not already been won. By the end of the move method, the agent should have placed one token into the game at some point. After the move() method is called, the game engine will check to make sure the move was valid. A move might be invalid if: - No token was place into the game. - More than one token was placed into the game. - A previous token was removed from the game. - The color of a previous token was changed. - There are empty spaces below where the token was placed. If an invalid move is made, the game engine will announce it and the game will be ended.

Specified by:
move in class Agent

moveOnColumn

public void moveOnColumn(int columnNumber)
Drops a token into a particular column so that it will fall to the bottom of the column. If the column is already full, nothing will change.

Parameters:
columnNumber - The column into which to drop the token.

randomMove

public int randomMove()
Returns a random valid move. If your agent doesn't know what to do, making a random move can allow the game to go on anyway.

Returns:
a random valid move.

public Connect4Slot slotAtIJ(int row,
                             int col)
Takes the row and col, and return the slot correspoding to it

Parameters:
row - The row of the demanded slot
col - The column of the demanded slot
Returns:
the Corespoding Slot

theyCanWin

public int theyCanWin()
Returns the column that would allow the opponent to win. You might want your agent to check to see if the opponent would have any winning moves available so your agent can block them. Implement this method to return what column should be blocked to prevent the opponent from winning.

Returns:
the column that would allow the opponent to win.
